page.title: 17HISTORY IN HANDCROSS
page.content: Handcross is a small village.Places like Handcross were well known stopping points in the old coaching days for changing the horses.The horses changed at "The Red Lion Inn".A locomotive named after the village was built in 1883.In 1906 a bus crashed on Handcross Hill.10 people were killed and 24 were injured in the crash.The "Fountain Inn" in Handcross was called "Brighton Rock".They sold Ales and stout.In 1937 Handcross High Street was decorated for the coronation of King George VI .Handcross Flower show and Sports was first started in 1906. This was held in "The Red Lion Inn", which is now Truggers housing estate.
